text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen I 
am in Bangkok Thailand in my parents beautiful

backyard and usually when I'm in Thailand I share 
with you delicious foods and restaurants or in the

market but there is one other place that's full 
of delicious food that is often overlooked and

that is the super market high supermarkets are 
great place to grab snacks for your road trip

or for your hotel room but with thousands and 
thousands of options on the shelf it might be

a little hard to know which it's worth trying so 
to help you with that I have selected seven items

that I think you should try when you are here I 
made sure that these items made three different

criteria one they have to be delicious otherwise 
why would we bother and - they must be available

at any major supermarkets in Thailand so that no 
matter where you are in the country you should be

able to find them and finally 3 they must not 
be easy to make at home which makes them even

more important that you try them now while you 
can't alright let's get started so the first

thing to try is one of my absolute favorite 
savory snacks and that is kao tung Moo yong or

rice crackers with pork floss so cow tongue is 
rice crackers and Moo Yong is pork floss we call

it pork but basically it's Chinese style dried 
shredded pork this stuff is addictive oh look

at that and they come in a few different flavors 
but this is the classic so so crunchy look at that

it's just so satisfying explosion airy crunch 
and the pork adds a mommy it's a little sweet

this one also has some nori in it which I love 
there's actually my new favorite one check this

out oh yes if you are nori fan this one is for you 
doesn't have to be this brand there are many many

brands out there sometimes it comes in a clear 
package but look for rice crackers with pork

plus you will not go wrong if you love to snack 
on dried fruit this next one is for you dried

bananas and not any dried bananas dry tie bananas 
and when we drive it on is we use a variety called

gluing my which are the short fat bananas that 
I use for my fried bananas and we usually use it

for cooking and it's so sweet and so fruity it's 
really very different from the regular banana that

you have and when you dry some dry it they don't 
need to add any sugar at all and the natural sugar

just becomes natural glazed it becomes what I 
call banana fudge mmm it's like chewy sweet but

it's got a fur dienes to it there is a tartness 
in there so satisfying to chew it's quite sweet

so usually one of these and I'm good great plain 
snacks and you can find this basically any where

any supermarkets in Thailand this next one is for 
all you cookie monsters out there I'm definitely

one of them I love cookies these are tone one or 
coconut roll cookies yeah now these are light and

delicate they're not hard to make but it requires 
a special press a special griddle so that kind of

falls into my category of not easy to make at 
home because it requires a different equipment

but these are so light and crumbly crumbly kind 
of like a wiill cookie and it uses coconut milk

as the liquid so it's got that coconut flavor 
this one has black sesame seeds which is pretty

common just listen to this crunchy flakiness and 
these also come in different flavors you can get

coconut flavor which is the classic durian flavor 
of your fan tyro flavor even corn flavor so lots

of options there and these make great gifts I 
often bring these back for the peeps in Canada

now I don't know about you but when I'm in a 
different country I'm always curious about the

different variations of the same thing that I'm 
familiar with so for this one I would like to

recommend to you some Thai flavors potato chips 
that's right now in Thailand they love coming

up with new flavors of Lay's especially every 
time I come here there's always a new flavor

on the shelf and I'm always interested in what 
they come up with and trust me they are very

creative so for example this one is the one I've 
never seen before hot chili squid flavor and then

this one is me and [ __ ] flavor now if you know 
me and come it's so it's it's an appetizer made

of lots of different ingredients coconut peanut 
ginger lime wrapped in wild beauty leaf I have

a recipe for it and there's a lace flavor of 
that it always kind of freaks me out how how

closely they can capture the iconic flavor 
of the food I definitely get get glimpses

of me and come if I didn't know this was a man 
come flavor I might be like oh that's tastes

so familiar but I don't quite know what it is 
but if you tell me it's being kind I'm like oh

yeah that I I definitely taste that let me see 
and by the way in Asia we like to make potato

chips seafood flavor so it's shrimp flavor squid 
flavor fish fish flavoured this one looks good

Oh horse good oh it's definitely squiddy taste of 
dried squid whip sweet chili sauce they managed

to get that grilled flavor in there too like 
that grilled squid flavor that's amazing let

me know what kind of lace flavor this unique 
to your country that you think is really cool

really interesting or really good share with 
me in the comments this next one may not be

for everybody but if you are a durin lover it is 
for you and if you are curious adventurous eater

it is also for you so this is durian fudge I like 
to call things fudge because you know some things

are just so fudgy and this is definitely one of 
them this is basically durian meat that's been

cooked and concentrated down into a fudgy paste 
I would consider this candy and it always comes

in this log shape packaging all you have to do 
to eat it is untie this little thing this part

here may not look the most appetizing but you just 
kind of like squeeze out a little chunk and it'll

come right up yes I know it looks a little weird 
let's look at this look at this fudgy pace and

interestingly the drink flavor is not as strong 
in here as it is in the fresh one mmm I don't

know what is about it but ma'am and it's just got 
a mild durian flavor has a texture of like really

soft caramel yeah maybe think of it as durian soft 
caramel definitely very interesting nothing like

it so give it a go Kyla is known for peanuts right 
we use peanuts a lot in our cuisine but what some

of you may not know is that we also turn peanuts 
into really delicious next this is peanuts that

it's a classic brand of peanut snacks that I grew 
up with it's older than me by gosh know how many

years and there are many flavors but today I'm 
going to recommend to you chicken flavor that's

right chicken flavored peanut you heard me right 
and as weird as it sounds it is so good and it

comes in the tanks and it is the most addictive 
state like I have such a hard time stopping eating

these so it is kind of dangerous I can actually 
get this in Canada at the tigris restore and I

gave this Adam and he just about went mad for them 
look and their peanuts coat it in sort of a thin

flour coating it it's like so mommy intense and 
in tyree which describe is as money I have such

a hard time translating that word into English but 
it's it's such a month ooh to have as like nhong

nhong nhong remember you can't you just can't 
sell so give it a go you can find this anywhere

even at the 7-eleven lastly it is another classic 
snack I grew up with and that is squiddy yes you

may notice that we like squid here in Thailand 
now this is baked crispy squid it is not cheap

okay because it's like concentrated squid squiddy 
actually has two types of squid one is dried and

sort of rolled flat kind of hard to describe 
kind of like squid jerky okay squid jerky is

the word but then this variety they bake it so 
it's crunchy and this is what I always go for
so addictive

it's crunchy but as you start to chew it 
it becomes a little chewy so you get you

really get to you know to munch on it 
a little touch of spicy a little sweet

half-sack not sponsored by sweetie or anything 
else that I talked about today and I've got an

eighth bonus one yeah that's a little treat for 
all of you who stayed to the end now this one I

made it a bonus because it meets two of the three 
criteria and the one that it doesn't meet is that

it's not available yet in all major supermarkets 
in Bangkok I am talking about banana chips but not

just any regular banana chips these are banana 
chips sandwich with a tamarind filling that's

right check this out it's like a healthier 
version of Oreo but so much more satisfying

I'm not even kidding you it's so so good at 
first when I thought of like that's a weird

and I ate it and I was like that's good and it 
makes such great gifts to that tamarind filling

is a little tart sweet but it's got a chew so 
you've got the crunchy banana chips and it's

not hard you know some banana chips can be hard 
this is crunchy and airy and then you get chewy

hammerin and the combination is just deadly 
in a good way and that is it for today I hope

that next time you come to Thailand you make a 
stop at your local supermarket and you will be

glad you did and if you've got other suggestions 
other things that you think should be added to my

list let me know in the comments you can even 
share photos of said items on Facebook Twitter

or Instagram on all of those things and if you 
haven't subscribed to the show please do so right

here I'll put the button somewhere and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious time
